children.name: the way sb or sth looks
appearance
children.definition: the way someone or something looks to other people :
examples: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sb’s/sth’s appearance
I wish she’d do something about her appearance - she’s always such a mess.
Concentrate on the content of your essay, not its appearance.
appearance of
They’ve changed the appearance of the whole building.
in appearance
The mushrooms are similar in appearance to poisonous one, so you have to be careful.
have the appearance of sb/sthlook similar to someone or something
The waitress, although she was only about 40, had the appearance of a very old woman.
The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
She had anoutward appearanceof calm, but deep down she was really worried.
The metal postsspoiled the appearanceof the garden.
The pupils looked angelic – butappearances can be deceptive.
He was,to all appearances, a respectable, successful businessman.
sb’s/sth’s physical appearanceIf you want to improve your physical appearance, eat well and exercise.
sb’s personal appearanceTeenagers are very conscious of their personal appearance.
sb’s/sth’s odd/strange appearanceChildren sometimes stared at him because of his odd appearance.
a distinctive/striking appearance(= unusual and interesting)The unusual leaves give the plant a distinctive appearance.
an attractive/handsome/pleasing etc appearanceLarge blue eyes set in a long thin face give him a striking and attractive appearance.
sb’s youthful appearanceShe was no longer a young woman, despite her youthful appearance.
the general/overall appearanceThe second phase of the project is to improve the town’s overall appearance.
the visual appearanceIntensive farming changed the visual appearance of the countryside.
have a ... appearanceThe young girl had a pleasing appearance.
improve/enhance the appearance of sth/sbFresh air improves the appearance of the skin.
change/alter the appearance of somethingThe proposed dam will change the appearance of the surrounding countryside enormously.
give sth/sb a … appearanceHis uniform gave him an official appearance.
take pride in your appearance(= make an effort to look good)She seems to take no pride at all in her personal appearance these days.
judge by appearances(= make judgements based on the way somebody/something looks )You shouldn’t judge by appearances.

children.name: looks
children.definition: sb’s appearance, especially when considering how good-looking they are.Looksis less formal thanappearance:
examples: sb’s looks
Girls of that age are always worried about their looks.
Emily had refused to marry him on account of his looks.
good looksa good-looking appearance
People generally describe him as having boyish good looks.
keep/lose your (good) looksremain or stop being good-looking
She was 20 years older now, but had managed to keep her looks.

children.name: look
examples: ▪ Doesn’t she look beautiful!
▪ That coat looks nice and warm. Where did you get it?
▪ The cake didn’t look very good, but it tasted all right.
▪ With his dark hair and dark eyes he looked Italian.
▪ I’m glad you’ve shaved off that beard. It makes you look ten years younger!

children.name: look like
children.definition: /ˈlʊk laɪk/  to have an appearance that is similar to someone or something else:
examples: ▪ She looks a bit like my sister.
▪ They just look like ordinary people to me.
▪ In the moonlight the plane looked like a huge eagle soaring across the sky.
